free_text.Learning outcomes: To provide an introduction to all aspects of the rapidly evolving field of frustrated magnetism:[br/] 1) New paradigms: spin liquids, spin ice, topological order[br/] 2) Basic models and methods[br/] 3) Experimental realizations[br/]
free_text.Content: 1) Introduction: definition and overview of frustration in magnetism[br/]2) Basic models[br/]3) Classical frustrated magnets: ground state degeneracy and ground state correlations[br/]4) Order by disorder: ordering by thermal or quantum fluctuations[br/]5) Spontaneous breaking of translational symmetry: valence-bond solids, magnetization plateaux [br/]6) Broken SU(2) symmetry without magnetic order: nematic order[br/]7) Spin liquids: Resonating-Valence Bond liquids, algebraic order, topological order[br/]8) Conclusion: open issues and perpectives [br/]
free_text.Keywords: Solid state physics, quantum magnetism, frustration, quantum phase transitions
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic courses of quantum mechanics, statistical physics and solid state physics
